result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lemar C Newell Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court to address bail.  Defense is requesting modification of bail to $20,000.  State place objection on the record.  Court DENIES the defense motion.

Discovery has been received.  Defense request a trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD.

Attorney Schindhelm is currently in trial an unable to appear.  Case is adjourned off the record. Date obtained through email between all parties.  Case is adjourned for Status conference on 8/9/2022 at 10:00 in br. 6.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO REVIEW BAIL, received and filed.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia and Nathan Opland-Dobs not in court, defendant Lemar C Newell not in court, in custody, not produced.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm not in court for the State of Wisconsin.

OFF THE RECORD.

Attorney Opland-Dobs unable to appear due to illness and attorney Schindhelm is currently in trial and unable to appear.  Parties stipulate for an adjournment.  Status conference rescheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  The status conference was held in person.  Defense requesting an additional status conference to review discovery.  The Court Grants defense request and order the matter adjourned to Branch 15.
  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case passed until 1:30pm due to calendar the case was passed until 1:30pm.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia and Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom video.
Case in court for Arraignment. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Defense in receipt of discovery and requests status hearing. Case remains calendared before Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  (21 pages) commencing  03-28-2022 by DANIELLE HOLCOMB.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO REVIEW BAIL

ADDRESS INFO for Lemar C Newell Jr
Current: 949 N 9th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 03-28-2022)
Prior: 4528 North 67th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Lesniewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant plans to retain private counsel. Defendant is advised by the Court that if he has not retained counsel by the next date that Attorney Cerniglia will remain as counsel for at least that date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with 1319 West North Avenue, in the City and County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lemar C Newell in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Lemar C Newell in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lemar C Newell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
